intro: Clavula multicaulis var. vivipara, commonly known as the viviparous clavula, is a variant of the clavula plant characterized by its unique reproductive strategy. This plant belongs to the family Apiaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. It exhibits vivipary, a phenomenon where seeds germinate while still attached to the parent plant. The stems are typically hairy and can grow up to several feet in height. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct aromatic scent, contributing to its ecological and botanical significance.
